snippet: Scientists warn that chemicals we’re exposed to every day can cause genital deformities and even breast cancer. Is our government paying attention?
abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column notes that scientists are increasingly critical of the government's failure to regulate the proliferation of environmental chemicals like bisphenol-A known as endocrine distupters, which can trigger hormonal changes in the body that may not show up for decades. (M)
lead_paragraph: Scientists are observing with increasing alarm that some very common hormone-mimicking chemicals can have grotesque effects. A widely used herbicide acts as a female hormone and feminizes male animals in the wild. Thus male frogs can have female organs, and some male fish actually produce eggs. In a Florida lake contaminated by these chemicals, male alligators have tiny penises.
